thread.title: Renee Zellweger shows off her fake baby bump as she shoots scenes for Bridget Jones's Baby
thread.title_full: Renee Zellweger shows off her fake baby bump as she shoots scenes for Bridget Jones's Baby

title: Renee Zellweger shows off her fake baby bump as she shoots scenes for Bridget Jones's Baby
text:
Renee Zellweger shows off her fake baby bump as she shoots scenes for Bridget Jones's Baby Renee Zellweger shows off her fake baby bump as she shoots scenes for Bridget Jones's Baby 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
If the title hadn’t given it away, then these new pictures from the set of the new Bridget Jones movie have. 
Renee Zellweger was back in character as Bridget and sporting a large prosthetic bump for scenes in the upcoming movie Bridget Jones’s Baby. (Daniel Leal-Olivas/PA) 
Zellweger wrapped up warm in a fluffy blue coat, striped top, blue jeans and black boots on set outside Sainsbury’s supermarket in Woolwich, south London. 
The store’s famous orange bag hung heavy in her hand as she reprised her eponymous character for Bridget Jones’s Baby, the third instalment of the franchise, 14 years after the first was released. (Daniel Leal-Olivas/PA) 
The full extent of her fake bump was obvious from the side and gave away at least one big plot spoiler. 
The second, we assume, is that Bridget is an avid collector of Nectar card points. (Daniel Leal-Olivas/PA) 
The actress had her blonde hair messily tied up, showing off her slimmer face and indicating that Bridget no longer needs to worry about having a bottom the “size of Brazil”. 
Renee gained 30lb to play Bridget in the first two films, but looked slim underneath the coat and prosthetic bump on set. (Daniel Leal-Olivas/PA) 
Colin Firth will return as Mark Darcy, whom Bridget became engaged to at the end of the second film, Bridget Jones: The Edge Of Reason. 
US actor Patrick Dempsey confirmed his involvement in the film with an Instagram shot in September, and he is rumoured to play a new love interest. 
The first official image from the movie was released by Working Title last week showing the actress smiling and having traded in her diary for a modern iPad. 
Author Helen Fielding released her third Bridget Jones novel, Mad About The Boy, in October 2013, although it is not known if the new film will follow the same plot. Share article 
According to IMDb, it is slated for release in the UK in September next year. Promoted Stories
